resources.string: To save the most energy, switch off the power point rather than leave appliances on standby.
Turn off your heater, cooling units and appliances when you go to bed or leave the house.
Switch off your computer and equipment such as printers or Wi-Fi routers overnight or when you\'re away.
To save the most energy, switch off the power point rather than leave appliances on standby.
The Philippines experiences warm weather year-round, making electricity consumption high, especially for cooling and lighting.
Open curtains and blinds during the day to utilize natural light and minimize the need for artificial lights. This simple switch can significantly reduce your electricity consumption.
Replace your traditional incandescent bulbs with energy-efficient LED bulbs. They last significantly longer and consume up to 90% less energy, saving you money and energy in the long run.
Install motion-sensor lights in areas like hallways, entrances, and even under cabinets. This ensures light is only used when needed, preventing unnecessary energy waste.
When the weather permits, open windows and doors on opposite sides of your house to create cross-ventilation. To your home cool and comfortable without relying on the AC.
Electronics in standby mode still consume energy, so unplug chargers, TVs, and other devices when not in use. Consider using power strips with on/off switches for easy control of multiple devices.
